    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AcceptJoinCommand
    Command that is executed when the server accepts a player's join request.
    App
    Entry point for the application.
    Board
     
    BoardHandler
    Handles mapping between board names and their corresponding Board objects.
    ChangePlayerColorCommand
    Command responsible for changing the color of a player's nickname in the GameViewController.playerListView so that the nickname color matches the color of the player's pieces on the board.
    ClassicBoard
    Represents the classic board layout on the client side.
    Client
    Represents a client that connects to the game server.
    Command
     
    CommandHandler
    A class responsible for mapping string commands to their corresponding Command implementations.
    ConnectingServerController
    Controller responsible for handling the "Connect to Server" view.
    Controller
     
    CreateGameController
    Controller for the "Create Game" view.
    DisplayCommand
    A command that displays a message (via an alert) on the client side.
    Field
    Represents a single field (circle) on the client-side board.
    GameViewController
    Controller for the in-game view.
    JoinGameController
    Controller for the "Join Game" view.
    MenuController
    Controller for the main menu view.
    SetFieldCommand
    A command that updates the state of a specific field on the board (e.g., setting player pieces).
    SetIdCommand
    Command responsible for setting the client's ID, usually triggered by the server when the game starts or a player's ID is reassigned.
    UpdatePlayerListCommand
    Command that updates the client's player list in the GameViewController.
    UpdateTurnCommand
    Command that updates the UI to indicate whose turn it is.
    Utils
    A utility class containing methods and data structures that assist with showing alerts, managing color maps, and potential future general utilities.
    ViewManager
    Manages switching between different views (scenes) in the JavaFX application.
    YingYangBoard
    Represents the Ying-Yang game board with specific color mappings.
